2D Echocardiography

A 2D Echocardiography (2D Echo) is a non-invasive ultrasound test that provides a detailed image of the heart’s structure and function. It allows doctors to assess how well your heart chambers and valves are working in real time.

What is a 2D Echo For?

  • Evaluating the size and shape of the heart
  • Checking heart valve function
  • Detecting abnormalities such as murmurs or heart defects
  • Assessing heart pumping strength (ejection fraction)
  • Monitoring patients with heart disease or hypertension
Quick, painless, and accurate: A 2D Echo gives a complete picture of your heart’s health to guide diagnosis and treatment.

How the Procedure Works

During the procedure, a transducer is placed on your chest to send and receive sound waves. These waves create moving images of your heart, displayed on a monitor for the doctor’s assessment.

Preparation

  • No special preparation is required.
  • Wear comfortable clothing for easy access to your chest area.
  • Follow any additional instructions provided by your doctor.

Results and Follow-up

The results of your 2D Echo help your physician understand your heart’s condition and recommend lifestyle changes, medications, or further tests if needed.
